title: BEAM-13189 Python TextIO: add escapechar feature.
body:
Add `escapechar` parameter to Python TextIO transforms: `ReadFromText`, `ReadAllFromText`: * escaped line delimiters are skipped when splitting, for example: `'aa\\\naa\n'` would result in 1 line `'aa\\\naa'` * this is for line splitting only, so escapechars are not removed from the lines, they are supposed to be parsed separately, for example with `csv` library * escaped escape chars are also handled, so that if there are odd number of escape chars before line delimiter - it will be escaped, but if there are even number of escape chars - all are treated as escaped themselves and the line delimiter will be used for splitting * using `bytes` type for the `escapechar` in line with the custom delimiter feature, but keeping name `escapechar` as in the `csv` library (arguable) * only 1 byte `escapechar` length is supported (in line with `csv`) Closes: BEAM-13189 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13009] Bugfix: Prevent dataloss in DynamoDBIO write if deduplication keys are not set (aws SDK v1)
body:
This is porting the fix in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15895 back onto the `aws` module for sdk v1. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12583 introduced a mechanism to deduplicate elements per batch based on deduplication keys. Unfortunately the mechanism is not backwards compatible. If upgrading without setting the deduplication keys all elements end up with the same empty deduplication key. As a result only one element per batch is ever written to DynamoDB, everything else is lost. This change makes sure elements are deduplicated based on element equality if no deduplication keys are provided. Missing unit tests for reads and writes are added to better catch such bugs in the future. Bugs in DynamoDBIOTest (using localstack) are fixed, further improvements of this (proper integration testing) should be done in BEAM-7559. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-13164] Address most of a race condition between instantiation and usage of member variables.
body:
There is a race condition being observed where we are passing the `InboundObserver` to the `outboundObserverFactory` [here](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/bee60cdc29d995170d4461692e391683ca7dcafd/sdks/java/fn-execution/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/fn/data/BeamFnDataGrpcMultiplexer2.java#L68). This allows for incoming calls to start before the BeamFnDataGrpcMultiplexer2 is fully initialized meaning that the erroredInstructionIds is accessed before it is initialized. This seems like a general problem with how we connect the inbound and the outbound observer (because of the ClientCallStreamObserver callack that is necessary) that only happens on the SDK harness since there is no need to connect the inbound and outbound observers this way on the ServerCallStreamObserver. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-13119] Subdirectory prefix tag for Go SDK
body:

See https://golang.org/ref/mod#vcs-version for the description of the requirement.) title: [BEAM-13173][Playground] Frontend Application CI/CD Scripts
body:
Add github actions workflow to build application. Steps that performed by that workflow: * Perform lint over go code * Perform tests via gradle task * Perform lint over Dockerfile * Perform Playground Frontend application build operation and push it to Artifact Registry * Call Terraform script to deploy application to GCP App Engine Following secrets should be set up in registry to support that CI `GCP_ACCESS_KEY` - base64 encoded JSON key for service account `REGISTRY_NAME` - Docker Registry address `PROJECT_ID` - GCP Project ID ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13181] Remove Sharding from FhirIO.Import
body:
The import operation on the FHIR API is made to handle large amounts of data, similar to a pipeline on apache beam. Starting an import operation on the FHIR API for a small amount of input is inefficient, as: - The operation will scale itself up to manage millions of resources of input, spinning up many operations (each for a small number of resources) incurs a lot of overhead costs in managing an operation. - There is a quota on the number of long-running operations on the FHIR service per project, which by default is 100. Therefore, creating 100 shards uses all this quota up in one instance of the pipeline. - It is possible to request increases for the quota, however limitations of the FHIR service mean that operations after a certain # will be unable to make progress until earlier operations complete. Therefore, sharding causes a severe loss of import performance and burdens the FHIR services. This change removing the sharding + GroupIntoBatches part of FhirIO.Import, relying on DoFns & bundle handling to partition import input into more reasonable, large batches of resources. Also updated comments & changed the import to move files instead of copying since we already handle re-tries resulting in missing files in the source. Renamed most occurrences of "Bundle" to "Batch", to avoid confusion with FHIR bundles. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-13590] Fix  abc imports from collections
body:
In python 3.3 a number of classes (Abstract Base Clases) from "collections" have been moved from "collections" to "collections.abc" and their use was deprecated. See https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html Since Pythnon 3.7 warning started to be generated, that the imports will be removed in 3.9. It did not happen till 3.10, however, it eventualy will so maybee worth fixing If anything - just to get rid of the warning. Beam uses Python 3.6+ so it is a safe change. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11440] Add integration test for KinesisIO using Localstack (aws2)

title: [BEAM-13099] Use `BlockBuilder.add(..)` rather than `BlockBuilder.append(Expressions.block(..))`
body:
The current logic in `toCalciteRow` wraps an `Expression` in a `BlockStatement` for use with `BlockBuilder.append`, but this is unnecessary. Instead we can just use `BlockBuilder.add` to add the `Expression` directly. This isn't a problem currently, but in Calcite 1.27.0 our current usage will begin raising an NPE (see [CALCITE-4869](https://issues.apache.org/CALCITE-4869)). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-11205] Google Libraries BOM 24.0.0 and associated deps
body:
Upgrading Google Cloud Libraries BOM to the latest version 24.0.0 and associated dependencies to the compatible versions. CC: @kennknowles # Linkage Check No new linkage errors: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/37ffe6928c1f6ca6d6a063690d0823d6 # Change to ApiSurface.java for Guava's ParametricNullness annotation Guava 31 introduced [ParametricNullness annotation](https://github.com/google/guava/commit/40faa2cb6a7e4aa9535b1a2a21265d533aca3eae) added to some of the Guava classes. As per the Javadoc, the annotation is targeted for Kotlin platform. (The annotation indicates the return value of generic function is not nullable iff the type in the type parameter is not nullable.) Before the change in ApiSurface.java, the annotation was marked as unexpectedly exposed type. ` ./gradlew -p sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform test --tests=GcpApiSurfaceTest` fails: ``` java.lang.AssertionError: Expected: API surface to include only: Classes in package "com.google.api.core" Classes in package "com.google.api.client.googleapis" Classes in package "com.google.api.client.http" ... but: The following disallowed classes appeared on the API surface: interface com.google.common.base.ParametricNullness exposed via: interface com.google.common.base.ParametricNullness interface com.google.common.base.Function class com.google.common.base.Optional class com.google.cloud.bigtable.config.CallOptionsConfig class com.google.cloud.bigtable.config.BigtableOptions class org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.bigtable.BigtableIO$Write class org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.bigtable.BigtableIO at org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat(MatcherAssert.java:18) at org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat(MatcherAssert.java:6) at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.GcpApiSurfaceTest.testGcpApiSurface(GcpApiSurfaceTest.java:128) ``` https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_Commit/19434/testReport/ Example usage of the annotation: ``` @ParametricNullness T get(); ``` This means that the method `get()` is nullable if type parameter `T` is nullable. It's non-null if `T` is non-null. This ParametricNullness annotation is not intend to be used other than Guava because it's not public. It's only visible to com.google.common.base package. ApiSurfaceTest should not detect this as exposed APIs. Initially, I tried to add an exception for the annotation class in GcpApiSurfaceTest.java. However, because the annotation class is only visible in Guava's package, I couldn't add it. Instead, I went for modifying the logic of ApiSurface.java not to report non-public annotation classes. This is because non-public annotations are not visible to Beam users and thus we don't have to consider them as exposed API surfaces. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-13081] Fixes a compatible issue of decoding null-value bitmap between JVM coder and Python Coder
body:
The JVM RowCoder strips trailing 0s from the null-value bitmap, while both python and go expect all bits to be present in the encoded bitmap. This causes index-out-of-range errors when trying to decode a row encoded on the JVM in other languages in some circumstances. This PR aims to add missing trailing 0s to the null-value bitmap to avoid the index-out-of-range error for Python Coder. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Minor: Replace usage of SqlExpressionChecker with ExpressionChecker
body:
`SqlExpressionChecker` just verifies that an expression produces a true result, while `ExpressionChecker` compares the result of an expression with an expected value. The latter produces much more helpful error messages, so we should use it everywhere. Currently the only usage of `SqlExpressionChecker` is in `BeamSqlDslSqlStdOperatorsTest.testStringFunctions` - replaced in this PR. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13138] Update code to retrieve container endpoint in DynamoDBIOTest (aws2)
body:

title: [BEAM-11936] Fix errorprone warnings
body:
Fixed errorprone warnings listed here: **CompareToZero:** The contract for Comparator#compare and Comparable#compareTo states that the result is an integer which is < 0 for less than, == 0 for equality and > 0 for greater than. While most implementations return -1, 0 and +1 for those cases respectively, this is not guaranteed. Always comparing to 0 is the safest use of the return value. **JodaPlusMinusLong:** JodaTime’s type.plus(long) and type.minus(long) methods are often a source of bugs because the units of the parameters are ambiguous. Use type.plus(Duration.millis(long)) or type.minus(Duration.millis(long)) instead. **SameNameButDifferent:** This type name shadows another in a way that may be confusing. **UnnecessaryAnonymousClass:** Implementing a functional interface is unnecessary; prefer to implement the functional interface method directly and use a method reference instead. For reference https://errorprone.info/bugpatterns ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13099] Use RelMetadataQuery subclass rather than calling RelNode.metadata
body:
`RelNode.metadata` is marked deprecated in Calcite 1.28.0, further it seems to force us to go through the `CachingRelMetadataProvider`, which appears to have issues with cache invalidation in 1.27.0 and beyond. Per conversations with Calcite developers in [CALCITE-4544](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-4544), we should be using this approach instead. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13183] [BEAM-8152] Use venv instead of virtualenv to create Python environments in Gradle scripts.
body:

title: [BEAM-8958] Use AWS credentials provider with BasicKinesisProvider (kinesis v1)
body:

title: [BEAM-13130] Remove persistent references to stateKeyReaders
body:
Keeping a list of the open stateKeyReader structs in the ScopedStateReader was holding on to memory for the life of bundles, leading to significant memory usage in large batch jobs. This removes that list altogether and puts the responsibility of closing the channel onto the stateKeyReader at EOF/on read error. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution!
